page.title: 10LIFE IN OLD BYFIELD
page.content: THERE USED TO BE A CONCERT PARTY WITH LOCAL GIRLS PERFORMING WHICH TOURED THE VILLAGES TO MAKE MONEY TO PROVIDE SWINGS FOR THE PLAYING FIELD.THERE WAS A MAYPOLE AT THE SCHOOL AND THE CHILDREN DECORATED HOOPS AND WAGONS WITH FLOWERS ON MAYDAY.DANCES FOR ADULTS WERE HELD AT THE TYTHE BARN AT THE BACK OF THE RECTORY.LATER,ONE OF THE SCHOOL CLASSROOMS WAS USED.THERE WAS A PRISONER-OF-WAR CAMP ON THE BODDINTON ROAD.THERE WAS AN IRONSTONE QUARRY ON THE PRIORS MARSTON ROAD WHERE MANY OF THE VILLAGERS WORKED.A CATTLE MARKET WAS HELD WHERE FIVE-WAYS GARAGE IS NOW AND A HORSE FAIR OPPOSITE JUBILEE CLOSE.SUNDAY JOINTS AND YORKSHIRE PUDDINGS WERE TAKEN TO BE COOKED AT THE BAKERY ALONG THE HIGH STREET.THE DOCTORS HAD A SURGERY ON THE CORNER OF NEW TERRACE. THEY ALWAYS EMPLOYED SERVANTS.
